org.ros.actionlib.client
Class ClientGoalHandle<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>

java.lang.Object
  org.ros.actionlib.client.ClientGoalHandle<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT>
Type Parameters:
T_ACTION_FEEDBACK - action feedback message
T_ACTION_GOAL - action goal message
T_ACTION_RESULT - action result message
T_FEEDBACK - feedback message
T_GOAL - goal message
T_RESULT - result message
public class ClientGoalHandle<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object

A GoalHandle is linked with a specific goal message and provides means to check the current state of progress and to re-send or cancel the goal. If a goal shall no longer be tracked, i.e. no further status, feedback and result messages shall be processed, its GoalHandle has to be #shutdown(). Every GoalHandle has its own CommStateMachine that monitors the communication between the action client that sent out the goal and the corresponding action server.

Constructor to create a GoalHandle using a specific GoalManager and CommStateMachine.

Parameters:
gm - The GoalManager used to manage sending or canceling goal messages
stateMachine - The CommStateMachine used to monitor the communication between action client and action server
Method Detail

shutdown

public void shutdown(boolean deleteFromManager)
Shuts down the GoalHandle and changes the GoalHandle's status to inactive. Further status, feedback or result messages regarding this GoalHandle's goal will not be received anymore.

Removes this GoalHandle from the GoalManagers list of active GoalHandles if requested.

isExpired

public boolean isExpired()
Checks whether this GoalHandle was shutdown or not.

Returns:
true - if this GoalHandle is not active anymore
false - otherwise

getStateMachine

public CommStateMachine<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> getStateMachine()
Gets the GoalHandle's CommStateMachine.

Returns:
The CommStateMachine that monitors the communication between the action client, that sent out the goal message associated with this GoalHandle, and the action server.

getCommState

public CommState getCommState()
Gets the current communication state from the CommStateMachine.

Returns:
A CommState object holding the current state.

getTerminalState

public TerminalState getTerminalState()
Returns the terminal state of this GoalHandle. This method should only be invoked when the GoalHandle's CommStateMachine is in state 'DONE'.
Possible terminal states are:
  • RECALLED
  • REJECTED
  • PREEMPTED
  • SUCCEEDED
  • ABORTED
  • LOST

Returns:
The terminal state of this GoalHandle. If the CommStateMachine is not in state 'DONE' the terminal state 'LOST' will be returned.

getResult

public T_RESULT getResult()
                                   throws RosException
Gets the result message received from the action server.

Returns:
Throws:
RosException

resend

public void resend()
Re-sends the GoalHandle's goal message. This can be necessary when the action server didn't receive the goal message which was sent out before.

cancel

public void cancel()
            throws RosException
Cancels this GoalHandle's goal by sending a cancel message to the action server.

Throws:
RosException
